concept.title: Headers
concept.shortdesc: A header forms the anchor point for a singly linked list.

conbody.p: A header forms the anchor point for a singly linked list. In common with the elements of the list, the header includes link objects as components.
The header includes the following functionality:

li.p: allows elements to be added to the start and end of a singly linked list, but not to the middle.
tests if an element is at the start or end of a list.
returns pointers to elements at the start or the end of a list.

conbody.p: A header is an instance of the templated class TSglQue<class T>.
